revised_title: Measurement of an Arc on the Meridian and Determination of Earth's Compression at the Poles
tldr: The author, William Lambton, measured an arc on the meridian between latitudes 8°9'38" and 18°3'23" to determine the Earth's shape and compression at the poles. The measurements were taken using triangulation and chain measurements, and the results were used to calculate the mean degree of the Earth's surface. This work contributed to the understanding of the Earth's shape and helped in the development of surveying techniques.
